climbs.name: Ventana
climbs.fa: Brad Singer, Dave Honeywell and Mike Rigney, August 1999

content.description:
This direct finish to

Twin Cracks

starts the same as that route and then continues straight up featured face once you hit the prominent horizontal crack. Good climbing on this but it's marred by a hard to clip bolt (the 1st) which can be troublesome for shorter climbers.
content.location:
Left side of the west face with a shared start with

Twin Cracks

.

content.description: Start up the obvious twin cracks (crux), pass a prominent horizontal and then move left into a wide crack which narrows to a thin crack at the top.
content.protection: Gear to 3.5", 2 bolt anchor at the top
content.location: Furthest route left on the west face at the obvious double crack system.

content.description: Start up a flaring crack past a bolt and mantle onto a ledge then up a short right-facing corner to a prominent roof. Pull the roof and move left to finish up face past two bolts to anchors on the summit.
content.location:
Right of center between

Hot for Teacher

and Changing Corners (5.9).

content.description:
This may be "Changing Corners" that C Miller mentioned in the "Small Wooden Babies" description I am not sure. But it felt harder than 5.9 so maybe not.

Anyway, start up "Small Wooden Babies" and ascend to the roof. Work right instead of left and pull onto a small ledge before finishing up to the anchors.
content.protection: 1 bolt, small to 2", 2 bolt anchor (shared with Hot for Teacher)

content.description: Climb up to and past a short right-facing flake and then pass several horizontals to a crux reach move up high and then easier climbing to the top.
content.location:
Between

Aswad

and

Small Wooden Babies

.

content.description:
Far to the right of this crag is a fairly thin, left facing flake/crack. Climb or hike to the base of the flake and work up an awkward layback.

Hiking to the base, which is easy, makes this more like a 20ft route.
content.location: Far right of the crag, right of changing corners.

content.description:
I'm putting this up expecting someone to correct me, but here it goes:

Start up Small Wooden Babies, or some variation, until you reach the ledge under the roof. Work right about 10ft and into another right facing corner. Work up on good holds.

Taking a direct line up the center of the bulging west face is this thin and technical testpiece.

Climb up past several horizontals (#2 Camalot) to a wide crack with a bolt and onto a ledge. Continue over the bulge on thin, technical moves which ease to a final bolt on easier terrain and the anchors.
content.protection: 5 bolts, #2 Camalot or equivalent, 2 bolt anchor/rap
content.location:
Just left of center between

Ventana

and

Hot for Teacher

.
